author: Richard Phillips
method: For the koftas, soak five wooden skewers in a bowl of water for ten minutes. Place all of the kofta ingredients except the oil into a food processor and blend together until smooth. Divide the mixture into five equal portions and shape the mixture onto the top half of the skewers.  Heat the oil in a frying pan over a high heat. Fry the koftas on both sides for about 5-6 minutes until cooked through.   For the herb salad, mix the parsley leaves with the oil and seasoning in a bowl.  To serve, place the herb salad in the middle of a plate and arrange the koftas on top.
ingredients: 175g/6oz minced beef,  ¼ tsp ground turmeric powder,  1 garlic clove, peeled,  ¼ tsp dried chilli flakes,  pinch salt,  2 tsp dried oregano,  2 tsp ground coriander seeds,  1 tsp olive oil, for frying,  small bunch fresh parsley leaves,  2 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
